summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Financial Services, Inc., demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities for the period from January 1, 2018, onward. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Aurey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting financial records from UBS.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the holder of multiple accounts (including an IRA) at UBS Financial Services, whose records are being subpoenaed as part of a grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Strauss, as the prosecuting attorney, is issuing a subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to UBS Financial Services for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands UBS to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records by this date.

locations: UBS Financial Services, Inc., 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and several entities (Terramar Project Inc., Max Foundation, ELLMAX, LLC) from January 1, 2018, onward.
The investigation is for alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically 18 U.S.C. ยง 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests UBS not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The requested records are extensive, covering bank statements, wire transfers, identification documents, safe deposit records, loan applications, and online banking information.
The document indicates an active grand jury investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's finances was ongoing as of June 2020.
